Tried Mad Charcoal recently and had a great experience!

Beef Brisket: This was amazing! It was beautifully tender and the perfect meat to fats ratio! Rich and smoky flavours in every bite. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting.

Pork Ribs: Unfortunately, the pork ribs were a bit of a letdown. The portion size felt underwhelming for the price, and the meat lacked the tenderness I had hoped for, making it rather tough.

Sides: The sides, however, were a highlight! The mashed potato was wonderfully smooth and velvety, almost melting in the mouth, while the sweet potato cubes were perfectly cooked with a subtle sweetness that complemented the meal beautifully.

At $20.50 per main, the beef brisket was well worth the price, though I canâ€™t say the same for the pork ribs. Despite this, the coffee shop was well ventilated and airy, coupled with the exceptional sides and brisket. I will be back for another visit. Mad Charcoal is definitely a place worth trying!

Found this chill place while visiting the industrial park next door. We had the chicken chop and pork belly which were both restaurant level quality and very delicious. Both had the awesome Smokey taste that comes from a charcoal fire with just the right amount of char. The portions were also huge and well worth the price! The mashed potatoes were creamy and tasty but French fries were plenty but were a bit hard. The slaw was also good. Today I had the pleasure of trying the BBQ pork belly and chicken chop at this restaurant, and it was one of the best meals Iâ€™ve ever had! The pork belly was perfectly marinated and cooked to perfection, retaining its moisture and tenderness. The chicken chop was equally impressive, with a delightful charred flavor that added a wonderful depth to the dish.

What really stood out was the charcoal fragrance that enhanced the overall experience. The balance of flavors, the quality of the ingredients, and the skillful preparation truly made this meal unforgettable.

In addition to the fantastic food, the atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and the prices were very reasonable for the quality and portion sizes.

Had their rabbit leg and pork belly. Pork belly was amazing and accompanied with the char tasted great. The rabbit legs was a little on the dry side but similar to chicken taste. Had the aglio for sides and was okay with a poached egg on top as well as another mash potato on the side. Good texture but not very creamy. Overall was a good meal and would visit again
